root_causes: Missing open-text presence validation corresponding to CheckMultiOpenD1()
Missing open-text length validation corresponding to CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(CurrentForm(),5,0,"chars")
Open-text checks are not conditioned on the question being answered (i.e., missing the f('A4x1').toBoolean() conditional)
instructions: Add logic to enforce CheckMultiOpenD1(): when any A4x1 sub-item that requires an open response (e.g., an 'Other' option) is selected, flag records where the associated open-text field(s) are empty or only whitespace. Implement this by OR-ing a condition into the sel if that checks (any(A4x1_1,A4x1_2,A4x1_3,A4x1_4,A4x1_5,1) AND (miss(A4x1_OE) OR strip(A4x1_OE) = "")). Replace A4x1_OE with the actual open-text variable name(s).

Add logic to enforce CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(CurrentForm(),5,0,"chars"): flag records where the open-text field exists but has fewer than 5 characters. Example SPSS condition to OR into sel if: ( any(A4x1_1,A4x1_2,A4x1_3,A4x1_4,A4x1_5,1) AND (char.length(rtrim(ltrim(A4x1_OE))) < 5) ).

Wrap the open-text presence and length checks so they only run when the multi question has any selection (i.e., implement the f('A4x1').toBoolean() behavior). Concretely, combine the existing checks with the open-text checks using OR so all validation failures (invalid codes, none selected without DK, missing/too-short open text) are flagged in the same sel if.

If there are specific open-text variables tied to particular sub-items (for example only when code 99/Other selected), ensure the checks target those specific open-text variables (e.g., if A4x1_5=99 then validate A4x1_5_OE exists and length >=5).
